docs.lead_paragraph: Two events last week involving mechanical heart implants have raised questions about whether research should focus on devices that replace the heart completely, or on ones that assist the heart by taking over some of its pumping. The devices were developed for people who are dying of heart failure, a condition in which the heart muscle becomes too weak to pump effectively. Heart failure, often caused by atherosclerosis and high blood pressure, has become a major public health problem, affecting five million Americans.

headline.main: How to Assist Failing Hearts? New Questions Emerge

docs.lead_paragraph: Some fashion models with beautifully shaped heads may choose baldness as part of their look. But for most women, loss of hair -- or even thinning of it -- is highly upsetting, often much more so than for men. The relatively extensive hair loss that often occurs after pregnancy frightens many a new mother. And women commonly describe hair loss as the most devastating aspect of chemotherapy, even though they know their hair will grow back after the treatments are over.

headline.main: When a Woman Loses Hair: New Insights
